info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 9:53PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Black Cypress Bayou At Jefferson affecting Marion and Cass Counties.
For the Black Cypress Bayou...including Jefferson...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Black Cypress Bayou at Jefferson.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Saturday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 15.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 12/04/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Sunday evening at 1000 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
